channel.title: Randomline on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Randomline on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: A random walk through the rolodex
item.description: The evening's work can be roughly summed up as Generate a random item from my personal wiki that starts with 'A'. Much of the time, that will be a person's name. Comment on that person's weblog, if they have one, or otherwise get in touch. Repeat until 'Z'. In the course of doing this I came across an essay, otherwise unpublished, on "The algorithm driven day"

item.title: Contactually, an early review of this contact manager
item.description: I’m on a 30 day trial of Contactually, a contact manager that seems to handle one important function only: reminding you to follow up periodically with people who are important to you. On the plus side, it does a good job of importing data from my Google account and from a handful of social media sites, and by doing so the amount of manual labor needed to do something with it is kept to a minimum.
